comment.body:
Hello!

I thought about exact same problem. But I learned that you can try to load your site through some gateways like this one: http://bit.no.com:43110/1EU1tbG9oC1A8jz2ouVwGZyQ5asrNsE4Vr
After that possiblity to get your site available rises.

> [oracle](#comment_1_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): Your clock is messed up. It's to high up and is cut off. Here's a screenshot of what it looks like. https://imgur.com/sMKBJZ6


I agree about the clock though).

100 Gb is cool! But what about turning your computer into a gateway (like this one: http://bit.no.com:43110/1EU1tbG9oC1A8jz2ouVwGZyQ5asrNsE4Vr) ? This could help with demonstrating Zeronet to those people who don't want to install something before they can see that it is awesome.

Cool. I've tried to add my site to that list: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1G9s2eptrshvMmXaR1egEnGcbL9WdeQFAa
but nothing happened.
Maybe you should ask about it on ZeroTalk.

Could be a blockchain used for Identification?

BTW, please add 'newsfeed' button here.
Good idea! Maybe we can add some common setting in each site that it should or should not be automatically added on sites like 0list, 0neSite and ZeroCentral after being autoseeded.
